title: Controlled deer hunt at Chief Logan State Park temporarily halted 1 day ago
content: West Virginia Gov. Jim Justice temporarily halts a controlled deer hunt planned at Chief Logan State Park. (Cropped Photo: Courtesy: EPA)    LOGAN COUNTY, W.Va. (WCHS/WVAH) —    Plans for a controlled deer hunt at Chief Logan State Park have temporarily been halted by West Virginia Gov. Jim Justice.    Justice said he has become aware of concerns being raised about the hunt and has ordered the Division of Natural Resources to do further research on the proposal and report back to him in 30 days, according to a news release from the governor’s office.    “I’m an avid outdoorsman, and I want to be sure the DNR has looked at every facet of this, get all the facts and scientific research and then present it to me for consideration,” Justice said in the release. “We want to make a decision that balances the interests of all sides.”    Anyone who wants to express an opinion on the issue can contact the governor’s office by phone at 304-558-2000 or at governor.wv.gov .
